properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: zone
properties.description: (Required) The domain name of the zone.

properties.name: link
properties.description: (Optional) The target zone(domain name) to link to.

properties.name: primary
properties.description: (Optional) The primary zones' IP. This makes the zone a secondary. Conflicts with secondaries.

properties.name: additional_primaries
properties.description: (Optional) List of additional IPs for the primary zone. Conflicts with secondaries.

properties.name: ttl
properties.description: (Optional/Computed) The SOA TTL.

properties.name: refresh
properties.description: (Optional/Computed) The SOA Refresh. Conflicts with primary and additional_primaries (default must be accepted).

properties.name: retry
properties.description: (Optional/Computed) The SOA Retry. Conflicts with primary and additional_primaries (default must be accepted).

properties.name: expiry
properties.description: (Optional/Computed) The SOA Expiry. Conflicts with primary and additional_primaries (default must be accepted).

properties.name: nx_ttl
properties.description: (Optional/Computed) The SOA NX TTL. Conflicts with primary and additional_primaries (default must be accepted).

properties.name: dnssec
properties.description: (Optional/Computed) Whether or not DNSSEC is enabled for the zone. Note that DNSSEC must be enabled on the account by support for this to be set to true.

properties.name: networks
properties.description:
(Optional/Computed) List of network IDs for which the zone is
available. If no network is provided, the zone will be created in network 0,
the primary NS1 Global Network.

properties.name: secondaries
properties.description: (Optional) List of secondary servers. This makes the zone a primary. Conflicts with primary and additional_primaries. Secondaries is documented below.

properties.name: secondaries-1
properties.description: » Secondaries
A zone can have zero or more secondaries. Note how this is implemented in the example above. A secondary has the following fields:

properties.name: ip
properties.description: (Required) IPv4 address of the secondary server.

properties.name: port
properties.description: (Optional) Port of the the secondary server. Default 53.

properties.name: notify
properties.description: (Optional) Whether we send NOTIFY messages to the secondary host when the zone changes. Default false.

properties.name: networks
properties.description: (Computed)
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: zone
properties.description: (Required) The zone the record belongs to.

properties.name: domain
properties.description: (Required) The records' domain.

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) The records' RR type.

properties.name: ttl
properties.description: (Optional) The records' time to live.

properties.name: link
properties.description: (Optional) The target record to link to. This means this record is a 'linked' record, and it inherits all properties from its target.

properties.name: use_client_subnet
properties.description: (Optional) Whether to use EDNS client subnet data when available(in filter chain).

properties.name: meta
properties.description: (Optional) meta is supported at the record level. Meta is documented below.

properties.name: regions
properties.description: (Optional) One or more "regions" for the record. These are really just groupings based on metadata, and are called "Answer Groups" in the NS1 UI, but remain regions here for legacy reasons. Regions must be sorted alphanumerically by name, otherwise Terraform will detect changes to the record when none actually exist. Regions are documented below.

properties.name: answers
properties.description: (Optional) One or more NS1 answers for the records' specified type. Answers are documented below.

properties.name: filters
properties.description: (Optional) One or more NS1 filters for the record(order matters). Filters are documented below.

properties.name: answers-1
properties.description: » Answers
answers support the following:

properties.name: answer
properties.description:
• answer - (Required) Space delimited string of RDATA fields dependent on the record type.

    A:

    answer = "1.2.3.4"

    CNAME:

    answer = "www.example.com"

    MX:

    answer = "5 mail.example.com"

    SRV:

    answer = "10 0 2380 node-1.example.com"

    SPF:

    answer = "v=DKIM1; k=rsa; p=XXXXXXXX"

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region (Answer Group really) that this answer belongs to. This should be one of the names specified in regions. Only a single region per answer is currently supported. If you want an answer in multiple regions, duplicating the answer (including metadata) is the correct approach.

properties.name: meta
properties.description: • meta - (Optional) meta is supported at the answer level. Meta is documented below.

properties.name: filters-1
properties.description: » Filters
filters support the following:

properties.name: filter
properties.description: (Required) The type of filter.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: (Optional) Determines whether the filter is applied in the filter chain.

properties.name: config
properties.description: (Optional) The filters' configuration. Simple key/value pairs determined by the filter type.

properties.name: regions-1
properties.description: » Regions
regions support the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the region (or Answer Group).

properties.name: meta
properties.description: (Optional) meta is supported at the regions level. Meta is documented below. Note that Meta values for country, ca_province, georegion, and us_state should be comma separated strings, and changes in ordering will not lead to terraform detecting a change.

properties.name: meta-3
properties.description: » Meta

Metadata (meta) is a bit tricky at the moment. For "static" values it works as you would expect, but when a value is a datafeed, it should be represented as "escaped" JSON. See the Example Usage above for illustration of this.
Note that variables are still supported in the escaped JSON format. Note also that we intend to fix up this "escaped" JSON stuff as soon as possible, so please bear with us and plan accordingly.

Since this resource supports import, you may find it helpful to set up some meta fields via the web portal or API, and use the results from import to ensure that everything is properly escaped and evaluated.
See NS1 API for the most up-to-date list of available meta fields.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The free-form display name for the monitoring job.

properties.name: job_type
properties.description: (Required) The type of monitoring job to be run. See NS1 API docs for supported values.

properties.name: active
properties.description: (Required) Indicates if the job is active or temporarily disabled.

properties.name: regions
properties.description: (Required) The list of region codes in which to run the monitoring job. See NS1 API docs for supported values.

properties.name: frequency
properties.description: (Required) The frequency, in seconds, at which to run the monitoring job in each region.

properties.name: rapid_recheck
properties.description: (Required) If true, on any apparent state change, the job is quickly re-run after one second to confirm the state change before notification.

properties.name: policy
properties.description: (Required) The policy for determining the monitor's global status based on the status of the job in all regions. See NS1 API docs for supported values.

properties.name: config
properties.description: (Required) A configuration dictionary with keys and values depending on the jobs' type.

properties.name: notify_delay
properties.description: (Optional) The time in seconds after a failure to wait before sending a notification.

properties.name: notify_repeat
properties.description: (Optional) The time in seconds between repeat notifications of a failed job.

properties.name: notify_failback
properties.description: (Optional) If true, a notification is sent when a job returns to an "up" state.

properties.name: notify_regional
properties.description: (Optional) If true, notifications are sent for any regional failure (and failback if desired), in addition to global state notifications.

properties.name: notify_list
properties.description: (Optional) The id of the notification list to send notifications to.

properties.name: notes
properties.description: (Optional) Freeform notes to be included in any notifications about this job.

properties.name: rules
properties.description: (Optional) A list of rules for determining failure conditions. Job Rules are documented below.
Monitoring Job Rules (rules) support the following:

properties.name: key
properties.description: (Required) The output key.

properties.name: comparison
properties.description: (Required) The comparison to perform on the the output.

properties.name: value
properties.description: (Required) The value to compare to.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The free-form display name for the notify list.

properties.name: notifications
properties.description: (Optional) A list of notifiers. All notifiers in a notification list will receive notifications whenever an event is send to the list (e.g., when a monitoring job fails). Notifiers are documented below.
Notify List Notifiers (notifications) support the following:

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) The type of notifier. Available notifiers are indicated in /notifytypes endpoint.

properties.name: config
properties.description: (Required) Configuration details for the given notifier type.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The free form name of the data source.

properties.name: sourcetype
properties.description: (Required) The data sources type, listed in API endpoint https://api.nsone.net/v1/data/sourcetypes.

properties.name: config
properties.description: (Optional) The data source configuration, determined by its type, matching the specification in config from /data/sourcetypes.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: source_id
properties.description: (Required) The data source id that this feed is connected to.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The free form name of the data feed.

properties.name: config
properties.description: (Optional) The feeds configuration matching the specification in feed_config from /data/sourcetypes.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The free form name of the apikey.

properties.name: key
properties.description: (Required) The apikeys authentication token.

properties.name: teams
properties.description: (Required) The teams that the apikey belongs to.

properties.name: dns_view_zones
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the apikey can view the accounts zones.

properties.name: dns_manage_zones
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the apikey can modify the accounts zones.

properties.name: dns_zones_allow_by_default
properties.description: (Optional) If true, enable the dns_zones_allow list, otherwise enable the dns_zones_deny list.

properties.name: dns_zones_allow
properties.description: (Optional) List of zones that the apikey may access.

properties.name: dns_zones_deny
properties.description: (Optional) List of zones that the apikey may not access.

properties.name: data_push_to_datafeeds
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the apikey can publish to data feeds.

properties.name: data_manage_datasources
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the apikey can modify data sources.

properties.name: data_manage_datafeeds
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the apikey can modify data feeds.

properties.name: account_manage_users
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the apikey can modify account users.

properties.name: account_manage_payment_methods
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the apikey can modify account payment methods.

properties.name: account_manage_plan
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the apikey can modify the account plan.

properties.name: account_manage_teams
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the apikey can modify other teams in the account.

properties.name: account_manage_apikeys
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the apikey can modify account apikeys.

properties.name: account_manage_account_settings
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the apikey can modify account settings.

properties.name: account_view_activity_log
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the apikey can view activity logs.

properties.name: account_view_invoices
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the apikey can view invoices.

properties.name: monitoring_manage_lists
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the apikey can modify notification lists.

properties.name: monitoring_manage_jobs
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the apikey can modify monitoring jobs.

properties.name: monitoring_view_jobs
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the apikey can view monitoring jobs.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The free form name of the team.

properties.name: dns_view_zones
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the team can view the accounts zones.

properties.name: dns_manage_zones
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the team can modify the accounts zones.

properties.name: dns_zones_allow_by_default

properties.description: (Optional) List of zones that the team may access.

properties.name: dns_zones_deny
properties.description: (Optional) List of zones that the team may not access.

properties.name: data_push_to_datafeeds
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the team can publish to data feeds.

properties.name: data_manage_datasources
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the team can modify data sources.

properties.name: data_manage_datafeeds
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the team can modify data feeds.

properties.name: account_manage_users
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the team can modify account users.

properties.name: account_manage_payment_methods
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the team can modify account payment methods.

properties.name: account_manage_plan
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the team can modify the account plan.

properties.name: account_manage_teams
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the team can modify other teams in the account.

properties.name: account_manage_apikeys
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the team can modify account apikeys.

properties.name: account_manage_account_settings
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the team can modify account settings.

properties.name: account_view_activity_log
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the team can view activity logs.

properties.name: account_view_invoices
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the team can view invoices.

properties.name: monitoring_manage_lists
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the team can modify notification lists.

properties.name: monitoring_manage_jobs
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the team can modify monitoring jobs.

properties.name: monitoring_view_jobs
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the team can view monitoring jobs.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The free form name of the user.

properties.name: username
properties.description: (Required) The users login name.

properties.name: email
properties.description: (Required) The email address of the user.

properties.name: notify
properties.description: (Required) Whether or not to notify the user of specified events. Only billing is available currently.

properties.name: teams
properties.description: (Required) The teams that the user belongs to.

properties.name: dns_view_zones
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the user can view the accounts zones.

properties.name: dns_manage_zones
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the user can modify the accounts zones.

properties.name: dns_zones_allow_by_default
properties.description: (Optional) If true, enable the dns_zones_allow list, otherwise enable the dns_zones_deny list.

properties.name: dns_zones_allow
properties.description: (Optional) List of zones that the user may access.

properties.name: dns_zones_deny
properties.description: (Optional) List of zones that the user may not access.

properties.name: data_push_to_datafeeds
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the user can publish to data feeds.

properties.name: data_manage_datasources
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the user can modify data sources.

properties.name: data_manage_datafeeds
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the user can modify data feeds.

properties.name: account_manage_users
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the user can modify account users.

properties.name: account_manage_payment_methods
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the user can modify account payment methods.

properties.name: account_manage_plan
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the user can modify the account plan.

properties.name: account_manage_teams
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the user can modify other teams in the account.

properties.name: account_manage_apikeys
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the user can modify account apikeys.

properties.name: account_manage_account_settings
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the user can modify account settings.

properties.name: account_view_activity_log
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the user can view activity logs.

properties.name: account_view_invoices
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the user can view invoices.

properties.name: monitoring_manage_lists
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the user can modify notification lists.

properties.name: monitoring_manage_jobs
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the user can modify monitoring jobs.

properties.name: monitoring_view_jobs
